posts.title: Example Title 1: Let Her Rip
posts.desc: Meaning: Permission to start, or it could mean 'go faster!'

posts.title: Example Title 2: Like Father Like Son
posts.desc: Meaning: Resembling one's parents in terms of appearance or behavior.

posts.title: Example Title 3: Go Out On a Limb
posts.desc: Meaning: Putting yourself in a risky situation in order to help someone; or to hazard a guess.

posts.title: Example Title 4: Go For Broke
posts.desc: Meaning: To risk it all, even if it means losing everything. To go all out.

posts.title: Example Title 5: On Cloud Nine
posts.desc: Meaning: Having strong feelings of happiness or satisfaction.

posts.title: Example Title 6: Fit as a Fiddle
posts.desc: Meaning: Being fit as a fiddle means to be in perfect health.

posts.title: Example Title 7: Keep Your Shirt On
posts.desc: Meaning: Keeping calm. Usually said by someone who is trying to avoid making others upset.

posts.title: Example Title 8: When the Rubber Hits the Road
posts.desc: Meaning: When something is about to begin, get serious, or put to the test.

posts.title: Example Title 9: Right Out of the Gate
posts.desc: Meaning: Right from the beginning; to do something from the start.

posts.title: Example Title 10: Scot-free
posts.desc: Meaning: Getting away freely from custody, punishment, or any type of risky situation.

posts.title: Example Title 11: Dropping Like Flies
posts.desc: Meaning: To fall down ill or to die in large numbers.

posts.title: Example Title 12: Up In Arms
posts.desc: Meaning: Angry; being roused to the point that you are ready to fight.

posts.title: Example Title 13: Beating a Dead Horse
posts.desc: Meaning: To bring up an issue that has already been resolved.

posts.title: Example Title 14: Tug of War
posts.desc: Meaning: It can refer to the popular rope pulling game or it can mean a struggle for authority.

posts.title: Example Title 15: There's No I in Team
posts.desc: Meaning: To not work alone, but rather, together with others in order to achieve a certain goal.

posts.title: Example Title 16: Wake Up Call
posts.desc: Meaning: An occurance of sorts that brings a problem to somebody's attention and they realize it needs fixing.

posts.title: Example Title 17: Hard Pill to Swallow
posts.desc: Meaning: Something that's difficult to accept.

posts.title: Example Title 18: Wouldn't Harm a Fly
posts.desc: Meaning: Nonviolent; someone who is mild or gentle.

posts.title: Example Title 19: Read 'Em and Weep
posts.desc: Meaning: Often said by the winner in poker, as the others 'weep' over the loss.

posts.title: Example Title 20: Yada Yada
posts.desc: Meaning: A way to notify a person that what they're saying is predictable or boring.

posts.title: Example Title 21: Between a Rock and a Hard Place
posts.desc: Meaning: Being faced with two difficult choices.

posts.title: Example Title 22: Head Over Heels
posts.desc: Meaning: Falling deeply in love with another person

posts.title: Example Title 23: Cut The Mustard
posts.desc: Meaning: To cut the mustard is to meet a required standard, or to meet expectations.

posts.title: Example Title 24: Don't Look a Gift Horse In The Mouth
posts.desc: Meaning: When you receive a gift from someone, do not be ungrateful.

posts.title: Example Title 25: If You Can't Stand the Heat, Get Out of the Kitchen
posts.desc: Meaning: One should discontinue with a task if they are unable to cope with it due to pressure.

posts.title: Example Title 26: Short End of the Stick
posts.desc: Meaning: Getting the bad end of a deal, or receiving the least desirable outcome from something.

posts.title: Example Title 27: Cut To The Chase
posts.desc: Meaning: To get to the point, leaving out all of the unnecessary details.

posts.title: Example Title 28: Roll With the Punches
posts.desc: Meaning: To tolerate or endure through the unexpected mishappenings you may encounter from time to time.

posts.title: Example Title 29: Par For the Course
posts.desc: Meaning: What you would expect to happen; something normal or common.

posts.title: Example Title 30: Right Off the Bat
posts.desc: Meaning: Immediately, done in a hurry; without delay.

posts.title: Example Title 31: Jaws of Life
posts.desc: Meaning: Usually this references a tool used by rescuers when they pry or cut open a car to save the occupant.

posts.title: Example Title 32: Lovey Dovey
posts.desc: Meaning: The affectionate stuff that people do when they are in love, such as kissing and hugging.

posts.title: Example Title 33: Foaming At The Mouth
posts.desc: Meaning: To be enraged and show it.

posts.title: Example Title 34: Hands Down
posts.desc: Meaning: Anything that's easy or has no difficulty; something that is a certainty.

posts.title: Example Title 35: Curiosity Killed The Cat
posts.desc: Meaning: Typically said to indicate that any further investigation into a situation may lead to harm.
